column1: The Animal Control Department has issued a rabies warning. A rabid cat has been confirmed from a temple on the Thornburi side of the Memorial Bridge. They are watching and area which includes Thornburi, Chinatown and down to Bangrak.Although it is good practice anytime, now is a good time to consciously avoid those cute kittens and puppies

Yes.........Khlong San district is on the Thonburi side of river, and below is news blip, and below that is a map.bangkokpost.com/news/general/1111968/khlong-â€¦s18.postimg.org/xqd1m2cix/Khlong_San.jpgEdited: 3 years ago
anti-rabies and tetanus shots are always useful to have before travelling.
I understand that pre exposure immunisation for rabies is not widely available unless you are seriously at risk of infection.

It is always a good idea in any country to give strays a wide birth as often they are unpredictable and may bite or attack without provocation, even those that are not rabid pose a serious threat of infection and disease.
Well I am glad I got my rabies shots now...hate getting shots but the lady at the travel clinic was insistent.
Am I mistaken or is The Peninsula smack bang in the middle of the outlined rabies zone?
Yup; it's in the neighborhood. The Hilton is even closer.Edited: 3 years ago
We're there in 2 weeks. eek!I'm going to go & google rabies now.
